statement: The Budget Implementation Act 2022 No. 1 received royal assent on June 23, 2022.
According to the Civil Service Insurance Act, targeting cookies are used to establish user profiles for advertising purposes.
The Dominion Succession Duty Act RSC 1952 c 89 is currently included in the database of consolidated federal legislation on CanLII.

The Annulment of Marriages Act (Ontario) states that the law of England regarding annulment of marriage as it existed on July 15, 1870, is in force in Ontario, provided it is applicable and not repealed by specific acts.
The Canada Corporations Act is still in force as of 2025.

According to the Defence Services Pension Continuation Act, time served in His Majesty's regular forces may be counted in the term of service for pension for officers transferred to the permanent force in connection with the taking over by the Government of Canada of the garrisons of Halifax and Esquimalt.
According to the Exchequer Court Act, a railway company is automatically deemed insolvent if it calls a meeting of its creditors for the purpose of compounding with them.
According to the text, 'province' includes the Northwest Territories.
The Federal Court of Canada has jurisdiction in all matters of prize in Canada, subject to the Canada Prize Act.
The Customs Act applies to Her Majesty.
The Commercial Arbitration Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada.
The Financial Institutions and Deposit Insurance System Amendment Act RSC 1985 c 18 3rd Supp is current to 2025-01-22 according to the Justice Laws Web Site.
Part I of the Financial Institutions and Deposit Insurance System Amendment Act amends the Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions Act.
The Competition Tribunal can award costs against the Crown without any conditions.
The Canada Agricultural Products Act is NOT binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province.
The Emergencies Act allows for the detention of Canadian citizens based on their ethnic origin during a public welfare emergency.

According to Article III, the term 'Canada' includes any area beyond the territorial seas of Canada within which Canada may exercise rights with respect to the seabed and subsoil and their natural resources under the laws of Canada.
The Canadian Multiculturalism Act requires federal institutions to ensure Canadians of all origins have an equal opportunity to obtain employment and advancement.
The Canadian Agricultural Loans Act applies to loans made for home improvements.
According to the Divorce Act, a court always has jurisdiction to hear an application for a contact order in respect of a child, regardless of whether a parenting order has been made.
The Air Canada Public Participation Act prevails over the Canada Business Corporations Act in case of inconsistency.
The Canada Petroleum Resources Act applies to all frontier lands belonging to Her Majesty in right of Canada.
The Family Orders and Agreements Enforcement Assistance Act allows Her Majesty in right of Canada to be garnisheed for the enforcement of support orders and support provisions.
The Chief Executive Officer of the Enterprise Cape Breton Corporation is appointed by the Minister.
The President of the Atlantic Canada Opportunities Agency is appointed by the Governor in Council and holds office during pleasure.
A temporary member of the Canadian International Trade Tribunal is automatically deemed to be employed in the public service for the purposes of the Public Service Superannuation Act.
The Canadian Centre on Substance Abuse is an agent of Her Majesty in right of Canada.
The Minister is responsible for implementing civil emergency plans but not for their development.
An association can be incorporated under the Animal Pedigree Act even if the animals of the breed do not have significant value, as long as the breeders are well-represented.
The Arctic Waters Pollution Prevention Act applies to the internal waters of Canada within a specific area enclosed by defined coordinates.
According to the text, targeting cookies are used to establish user profiles for advertising purposes.
The Asia Pacific Foundation of Canada is an agent of Her Majesty in right of Canada.
The Auditor General can be re-appointed to the same office after their term
The Access to Information Act is intended to replace existing procedures for access to government information.
The Aeronautics Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province.
A security clearance is considered a Canadian aviation document for the purposes of sections 6.6 to 7.21 of the Aeronautics Act.
The Agricultural and Rural Development Act allows the Minister to enter into agreements with provinces for projects related to rural development.
The Agricultural Products Cooperative Marketing Act is still in force as of 2025.
The Governor in Council can grant authority to provincial boards to regulate agricultural product marketing within the province only.
The Department of Agriculture and Agri-Food is established by an Act of Parliament.
The Bank of Canada can establish branches and appoint agents or mandataries only in Canada.
The Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act is current to 2025-01-22 according to the Justice Laws Web Site.
Amendments to the Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act are listed in the document
Trustees do not need a license to act in bankruptcy proceedings.
According to the Bills of Exchange Act, a thing is deemed to be done in good faith if it is done honestly, regardless of negligence.
According to the Bills of Exchange Act, it is necessary for a person to sign an instrument with their own hand.
According to the Bills of Exchange Act, a bill of exchange that is not dated is invalid.
The Bills of Lading Act prejudices the right of stoppage in transit.

According to the Boards of Trade Act, a person can use 'Board of Trade' or 'Chamber of Commerce' as part of their business name if a board of trade already exists in that district, and they are not incorporated under the Act.
According to the Boards of Trade Act, the Governor in Council can change the boundaries of a board of trade's district upon application by the board.
The Bretton Woods and Related Agreements Act may be cited as such.
The Governor in Council can authorize acceptance on behalf of Canada of the Agreements.
The Bridges Act applies only to bridges constructed by railway companies.
The Canada Post Corporation Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province.
The Canada Water Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province.
The President of the Canadian Centre for Occupational Health and Safety is appointed by the Governor in Council after consultation with the Council.
The Corporation is for all its purposes an agent of Her Majesty in right of Canada.
The Canadian Dairy Commission is authorized to set quotas for dairy production.
According to the text, employment as a member of the Canadian Forces is always considered an exception for the purposes of the Canada Pension Plan.
The Canadian Ownership and Control Determination Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province.
According to the text, rules made by the Board are statutory instruments for the purposes of the Statutory Instruments Act.
The Canadian Payments Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada.
The Canadian Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission Act may be cited as the Canadian Radio television and Telecommunications Commission Act.
A member of the Commission can be removed at any time by the Governor in Council without cause.
The Chairperson is the chief executive officer of the Commission.
The Commission does not need to submit an annual report to the Minister.
Directions issued by the Minister under subsection 6(2) of the Canadian Security Intelligence Service Act are considered statutory instruments.
The Canadian Wheat Board Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province.
The President of the Cape Breton Development Corporation is automatically re-eligible for appointment after serving two consecutive terms.
According to the Carriage by Air Act, the absence of a passenger ticket always invalidates the contract of carriage.
The Minister of Veterans Affairs can extend the period for which assistance is provided if the student is making satisfactory progress.
According to the Citizenship Act, a 'citizen' refers to an individual with permanent resident status in Canada.
According to the Citizenship Act, a person born in Canada after February 14, 1977, is automatically a citizen, subject to certain exceptions.
According to the Citizenship Act, the Minister has the authority to waive certain requirements for citizenship on compassionate grounds.
The Canada Council for the Arts is an agent of Her Majesty.

The Canada United Kingdom Civil and Commercial Judgments Convention Act implements a convention between Canada and the United Kingdom providing for reciprocal recognition and enforcement of judgments in civil and commercial matters.
Under the Civilian War-related Benefits Act, male and female persons have equal status, rights, and obligations.
A foreign fishing vessel can enter Canadian fisheries waters without authorization if it's under a treaty.
According to the Competition Act, the term 'article' includes real and personal property of every description including money.
The Companies' Creditors Arrangement Act applies only if the total claims against the debtor company are more than $1,000,000.
The Consumer Packaging and Labelling Act applies to devices and drugs as defined in the Food and Drugs Act.
The Canada Deposit Insurance Corporation is not an agent of Her Majesty.
The Copyright Board is established by subsection 66(1).

According to the Corporations Returns Act, information contained in a return filed by a corporation pursuant to section 4 shall be made available to the Minister of Industry for inspection by any person on application at any reasonable time.
According to the text, CanLII uses cookies for various purposes including statistical analysis and website security.
The Criminal Code RSC 1985 c C-46 is current to 2025-01-22 according to the Justice Laws Web Site.
A record suspension removes any disqualification to which the applicant is subject under any Act of Parliament.
The Minister's prior approval is always necessary before disclosing a record of conviction for non-payment of a fine for an offence referred to in Schedule 3.
The Advance Payments for Crops Act applies only to crops grown in specific provinces within Canada.
According to the Crown Liability and Proceedings Act, proceedings in rem are authorized in respect of claims against the Crown.
The Cultural Property Export and Import Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province.
According to the Currency Act, defaced coins can still be considered current if they are only slightly damaged.

The Customs and Excise Offshore Application Act applies to goods arriving within the limits of the continental shelf of Canada for use as designated goods as if those goods were for use or consumption in Canada.
According to the Canada Evidence Act, a person is incompetent to give evidence if they have an interest in the case.
The Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation is not an agent of Her Majesty in right of Canada.
Amendments that are not included in the current version of the Canada Pension Plan statute come into force on 2025-01-01.
The Minister of Public Works and Government Services has exclusive authority to buy or otherwise acquire defence supplies required by the Department of National Defence.
According to the Diplomatic Service Special Superannuation Act, male and female contributors do not enjoy equality of status.
The Dry Docks Subsidies Act may be cited as such.
According to the Dry Docks Subsidies Act, ships of the Canadian Forces are entitled to the use of docks in priority to all other vessels.
The Department of the Environment Act allows the Minister to enter into agreements with provincial governments for carrying out programs related to the Minister's responsibilities.
The Canadian Environment Week Act designates the week including June 5th as Canadian Environment Week.
The Escheats Act allows the Governor in Council to grant escheated property to someone with a moral claim on the previous owner.
According to the Excise Act, 'Minister' means the Minister of Finance.
According to the Excise Act, 'rectifying spirits' means the process of refining spirits by re-distillation, filtration, or any other process.
The Excise Tax Act RSC 1985 c E 15 is current to 2025-01-22 according to the Justice Laws Web Site.
According to the document, cookies are used to target users for advertising purposes on CanLII.
The Experimental Farm Stations Act allows the Governor in Council to acquire land for establishing farm stations.
The Explosives Act applies to explosives under the direction or control of the Minister of National Defence.
The Export Act allows the Governor in Council to prohibit the exportation of petroleum in its crude state from Canada.
The Department of External Affairs was continued under the name of the Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade.
According to the Electoral Boundaries Readjustment Act, a commission is an agent of Her Majesty.
According to the Electricity and Gas Inspection Act, a contractor can always enter a purchaser's premises without notice to inspect meters.
The Energy Administration Act is not binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province.
The Deputy Minister of Natural Resources is the Chairperson of the Energy Supplies Allocation Board.
The Fertilizers Act applies to substances containing nitrogen, phosphorus, or potassium.
Inspectors do not need a warrant to enter a dwelling house if they have reasonable grounds to believe there is an article to which this act applies.
The Financial Administration Act RSC 1985 c F-11 has been amended retroactively.
The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Act establishes a department of the Government of Canada.

The Minister is liable under the Farm Improvement Loans Act to make any payment to a lender in respect of loss sustained by it as a result of a farm improvement loan made after the day on which sections 2 to 21 of the Farm Improvement and Marketing Cooperatives Loans Act come into force.
The National Farm Products Council consists of no less than three and no more than seven members.
The Federal Courts Act may be cited as such.
The Parliamentary Budget Officer is deemed to be a federal board, commission or other tribunal for the purpose of subsection 18(3).

According to section 8, judges of the Federal Court of Appeal and the Federal Court hold office during good behaviour but are removable by the Lieutenant Governor on address of the Senate and House of Commons.
The Federal Provincial Fiscal Arrangements Act deals with fiscal contributions to provinces.
The Minister of Health is responsible for the Federal Provincial Fiscal Arrangements Act.
According to the Feeds Act, 'feed' refers to any substance intended for consumption by or to meet the nutritional needs of livestock, or to prevent nutritional disorders in livestock.
The Canada Grain Act may be cited as the Canada Grain Act.
A commissioner can be engaged in commercial dealings in grain as long as they are a producer of grain.

The Canadian Human Rights Act allows for differences in wages between male and female employees if the difference is based on a reasonable factor prescribed by the Canadian Human Rights Commission guidelines.
The Department of Indian Affairs and Northern Development Act is still in force since 2019.
The Canada Labour Code is current to 2025-01-22 according to the Justice Laws Web Site.
Targeting cookies are used by CanLII to establish user profiles for advertising purposes.
Under the Canada Labour Code, an employee can refuse to work if there is imminent danger to their safety.
The Canada Labour Code deals with Industrial relations, Occupational Health and Safety.
The Fair Wages and Hours of Labour Act applies to the purchase of materials, supplies, or equipment for use in the work contemplated under any contract of sale and purchase.
The Canada Oil and Gas Operations Act applies to Sable Island.
An order made by the Oil and Gas Committee is considered a statutory instrument.
The Department of the Solicitor General Act was repealed in 2005.
The Canada Shipping Act RSC 1985 c S 9 is still in force.
Strictly necessary cookies can be deactivated in CanLII's website.
The Canada Shipping Act 2001 amended the Canada National Marine Conservation Areas Act
Targeting cookies are used by CanLII to establish user profiles.
The Minister of Transport holds office for a fixed term as determined by the Governor in Council.
The Department of Veterans Affairs Act may be cited as such.

The Dominion Water Power Act applies to all lands and properties that may be acquired for the purposes of the Act or may have been acquired and are still used in connection with Dominion water powers.
The Canada Wildlife Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province.
The Acts containing Agreements and Conventions listed in the document are included in the database of consolidated federal legislation.
The British Columbia Indian Lands Settlement Act allows for reductions or cutoffs from reserves without surrender by Indians.

According to the Alberta Natural Resources Act, the Province of Alberta is entitled to further rights to natural resources beyond those specified in the agreement, ensuring equality with rights conferred upon Saskatchewan.
The Caughnawaga Indian Reserve was divided into six sections by an Order in Council of the fifth March 1889.
The Order in Council of the 12th July 1906, which reorganized the Caughnawaga Indian Reserve, was explicitly authorized by The Indian Act.
The bonds and other obligations of the Bridge Authority are a debt of the Dominion of Canada.
The Canadian Forces Act 1950 is included in the database of consolidated federal legislation.
The Campobello Lubec Bridge Act requires that construction cannot commence until plans and drawings have been approved by the Governor in Council.
The Act confirms an agreement between the governments of Canada and New Brunswick regarding Indian Reserves.
The Canadian Bill of Rights applies to all matters within the legislative authority of the provinces.
The Boucherville Islands Bridge and Tunnel Act authorizes the Province of Quebec to construct a bridge and tunnel across the St. Lawrence River at the Boucherville Islands.
The Blue Water Bridge Authority is considered an agent of Her Majesty.
The Employment Support Board consists of members appointed by the Prime Minister of Canada.
The Federal Provincial Fiscal Arrangements Act 1972 allows the Minister of Finance to make payments to provinces for revenue equalization.
The Canada Belgium Income Tax Convention Act 1976 is Part II of chapter 104 of the Statutes of Canada 1974-75-76.
The Convention applies to taxes on income only.
SC 1976-77, c. 38 is an Act to Amend the Currency and Exchange Act and Other Acts in Consequence Thereof.
SC 1979 c 7 confirms the acquisition of specific lots in the Township of Hull by the Federal District Commission.
The Cooperative Energy Corporation is considered an agent of Her Majesty.
The Canada Germany Tax Agreement Act 1982 aims to avoid double taxation on income and certain other taxes between Canada and Germany.
According to Article 3, the term 'Canada' includes its territorial sea and air space.
The Canada United States Tax Convention Act 1984 has the force of law in Canada during the period specified by its terms.

Negotiations toward an agreement regarding cut off lands constitute an admission of legal obligation by Her Majesty in right of Canada.
The Condominium Ordinance Validation Act validates certain ordinances of the Yukon Territory and the Northwest Territories.

The Minister of Regional Industrial Expansion is authorized to dispose of securities of the Canada Development Corporation held by Her Majesty in right of Canada, with the approval of the Governor in Council.

The Financial Institutions Depositors Compensation Act allows for payments to be made to depositors of Canadian Commercial Bank, CCB Mortgage Investment Corporation, and Northland Bank in respect of uninsured deposits.
The Canadian Commercial Bank Financial Assistance Act was assented to on March 29, 1985.
The Government Companies Operation Act still applies to Canadian Arsenals Limited after this Act comes into effect.
According to the Act, in the event of a conflict between the provisions of this Act and any other law, the provisions of this Act shall prevail.
According to the Act, the Governor in Council's approval of a sale agreement needs to be published in the Canada Gazette to be valid.
The Canadair Limited Divestiture Authorization Act authorizes the Minister of Regional Industrial Expansion to acquire Class B shares of Bombardier Canadair Inc.

The Bell Canada Act allows the Company to acquire shares of another body corporate engaged in research and development work that relates to the Company's business activities, if that body corporate manufactures products for sale to the Company.
The Canada Newfoundland and Labrador Atlantic Accord Implementation Act applies to legislation that is excluded by section 8.
The Canada Nova Scotia Offshore Petroleum Resources Accord Implementation Act is current to 2025-01-22 according to the Justice Laws Web Site.
According to the Eldorado Nuclear Limited Reorganization and Divestiture Act, in the event of any inconsistency between this Act and the Canada Business Corporations Act, this Act prevails.

According to the Eldorado Nuclear Limited Reorganization and Divestiture Act, Subsection 108 1 of the Financial Administration Act applies in respect of any property rights or interests vested in Eldorado or a subsidiary of Eldorado by subsection 4.
The Canada United States Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada.
The Canadian Transportation Accident Investigation and Safety Board's findings are binding on parties in legal proceedings.
The Canadian Space Agency is authorized to enter into contracts in its own name, which are then binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada.
According to the Broadcasting Act, a person using a social media service to upload programs is considered to be carrying out a broadcasting undertaking.

The Broadcasting Act applies to transmissions of programs over the Internet that are ancillary to a business not primarily engaged in the transmission of programs to the public, if it provides information or services directly related to that business.
According to the Broadcasting Act, every broadcasting undertaking should not contribute to the implementation of the objectives of the broadcasting policy.
The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development Agreement Act may be cited as the SC 1991 c 12 Act.
The Bank of Canada acts as the depository in Canada for the assets of the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development.
The President of the Canada School of Public Service is appointed by the Governor in Council for a term not exceeding five years.
The Farm Income Protection Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province.

According to the British Columbia Grain Handling Operations Act, the term 'collective agreement' in Part I refers to the agreement that expired on December 31, 1989, between the employers association and the union.
The Crown Corporations Dissolution or Transfer Authorization Act includes provisions for the dissolution of the Canadian Livestock Feed Board.
The Bank Act SC 1991 c 46 is current to 2025-01-22 according to the Justice Laws Web Site.
The Cooperative Credit Associations Act was current to 2025-01-22 according to the Justice Laws Web Site.

The most recent amendment to the Cooperative Credit Associations Act listed in the provided text is SC 2017 c 26.
According to the Federal Real Property and Federal Immovables Act, a person can acquire federal real property by prescription.
The Canadian Polar Commission Act was in force between April 1, 2005, and June 28, 2012.
The Canadian Polar Commission Act is current to 2025-03-11.

The Canadian Heritage Languages Institute is an agent of Her Majesty.
The Executive Director of the Canadian Race Relations Foundation is automatically a voting member of the Board of Directors.
The Debt Servicing and Reduction Account Act was repealed in 2003.
The Commissioner of Corrections is appointed pursuant to subsection 6(1) of the Corrections and Conditional Release Act.
The Canada-Mexico Tax Information Exchange Convention Act 1991 is Part IV of chapter 3 of the Statutes of Canada 1992.
A foreign ship can engage in coasting trade in Canadian waters without a license if it is rendering assistance to a ship in distress.
The Energy Efficiency Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province.
The Canadian Environmental Assessment Act was repealed in 2012.
The Special Retirement Arrangements Act is enacted by Schedule I of SC 1992 c 46.

This statute is current to 2024-01-22.
The Contraventions Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province.
According to the Contraventions Act, an amount established under paragraph 8(1)(c) may exceed the maximum amount established for the relevant offence by the enactment creating the offence.
A special allowance is subject to tax under the Income Tax Act.
The Airport Transfer Miscellaneous Matters Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province.
The Corporation is an agent of Her Majesty in right of Canada.
The Child Day Act was assented to on 1993-05-06.
The Child Day Act designates November 20th as Child Day in Canada.

According to the Canada-Argentina Income Tax Convention, profits derived from the operation of ships or aircraft used principally to transport passengers or goods exclusively between places in a Contracting State may be taxed in that State.
The Electoral Boundaries Readjustment Suspension Act 1994 suspends the operation of certain sections of the Electoral Boundaries Readjustment Act.

The Canada Student Financial Assistance Act may be cited as such.
The Statutory Instruments Act applies to directives given by the Minister to appropriate authorities.
The Department of Citizenship and Immigration Act was assented to in 1994.
The Department of Natural Resources Act received assent in 1995.
The Department of Canadian Heritage Act establishes a department of the Government of Canada called the Department of Canadian Heritage.
The Budget Implementation Act 1995 is current to 2025-01-22 according to the Justice Laws Web Site.
The Minister of Industry also serves as the Registrar General of Canada.

The Alternative Fuels Act mandates that by the fiscal year commencing on April 1, 2004, 75% of motor vehicles operated by federal bodies and Crown corporations must be capable of operating on alternative fuels.
The CN Commercialization Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province.
The Chemical Weapons Convention Implementation Act is not binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province.
The President of the Business Development Bank of Canada is appointed by the Governor in Council and may be removed for cause.
The Firearms Act applies to the Canadian Forces.
According to the Act, a violation is considered an offence under the Criminal Code.
The Employment Equity Act applies to private sector employers with less than 100 employees.
The British Columbia Treaty Commission is considered an agent of the principals (Her Majesty in right of Canada, Her Majesty in right of British Columbia, and the Summit).
The Canada Transportation Act applies to specialty services.

The Agreement on Internal Trade Implementation Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada.

The Civil Air Navigation Services Commercialization Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province.
The Corporation (NAV CANADA) is an agent of Her Majesty in right of Canada.
The Employment Insurance Act was never amended retroactively.

The Payment Clearing and Settlement Act is repealed by this Act.
The Minister of Health's powers extend to all matters over which Parliament has jurisdiction relating to the health of the people of Canada.

The Canadian Food Inspection Agency is responsible for the administration and enforcement of the Food and Drugs Act in its entirety.

The Comprehensive Nuclear Test Ban Treaty Implementation Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada.
The Corruption of Foreign Public Officials Act applies only to actions committed within Canada.

According to the Canada Yukon Oil and Gas Accord Implementation Act, existing federal interests are immediately terminated on the transfer date.
The Canada Revenue Agency is not bound by the Canada Revenue Agency Act.

The Canada Health Care Early Childhood Development and Other Social Services Funding Act was assented to in 2000.

The Canada Costa Rica Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada.

Part 8 of the Federal Law Civil Law Harmonization Act No. 1 came into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.
The Commissioner of the Financial Consumer Agency of Canada can hold shares in any financial institution.
The Canada National Marine Conservation Areas Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada or of a province.
According to the Excise Act 2001, licences and registrations are statutory instruments.
According to the Canada Kuwait Tax Agreement Act, if there is an inconsistency between this Act and any other law, this Act prevails.
The Canada-Mongolia Tax Convention Act 2002 has no regulations associated with it.

According to the Export and Import of Rough Diamonds Act, in transit rough diamonds are deemed to be imported or exported.

The Canadian Air Transport Security Authority is an agent of Her Majesty in right of Canada.
The Canada Fund for Africa Act was assented to on April 12, 2002.

The Financial Advisors Association of Canada Act allows the corporation to issue share capital.
The Biological and Toxin Weapons Convention Implementation Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada.

SC 2004 c 25 amends certain acts to harmonize federal law with the civil law of Quebec.
The Minister can waive any requirements of the Canada Education Savings Act or the regulations related to the payment of CES grants or Canada Learning Bonds to avoid undue hardship.
According to the Assisted Human Reproduction Act, it is permissible to create an in vitro embryo for any purpose, including creating a human being or for research.

The Department of Social Development Act received Royal Assent on July 20, 2005.
The Canada Border Services Agency is not considered an agent of Her Majesty in right of Canada.

The Economic Recovery Act Stimulus was assented to on December 15, 2009.
The Canada EFTA Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada.
The Celebrating Canada's Seniors Act establishes National Seniors Day to acknowledge seniors' contributions.

The Extractive Sector Transparency Measures Act applies to all corporations operating in Canada, regardless of their revenue or assets.

According to the Act, any surplus recorded in the Public Accounts must be applied to reduce the federal debt.

The Budget Implementation Act 2018 No. 1 is current to 2025-01-22 according to the Justice Laws Web Site.
The Federal Framework on Post Traumatic Stress Disorder Act mandates a review of the framework's effectiveness five years after the report referred to in section 4 is published.
According to the Cannabis Act, informational promotion includes providing factual information about a cannabis accessory or its characteristics.
According to the Cannabis Act, it is legal for an individual who is 18 years of age or older to possess any amount of illicit cannabis as long as it is for personal use.
According to the Cannabis Act, the Youth Criminal Justice Act applies to contraventions of the Cannabis Act or its regulations.
The College of Patent Agents and Trademark Agents is an agent of Her Majesty.

The Accessible Canada Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada.

The Department of Crown Indigenous Relations and Northern Affairs Act allows the Minister to delegate any of his or her powers, duties, and functions under the Act to the Minister of Indigenous Services.

The Anishinabek Nation Governance Agreement is considered a treaty under section 35 of the Constitution Act, 1982.

The Budget Implementation Act 2024 No. 1 received royal assent in 2024.
The Canada Early Learning and Child Care Act recognizes the role of provinces and Indigenous peoples in providing early learning and child care programs and services.
